  1. Basic

    1. Object

      Object's methods and meanings:
      1. public String .toString(): conversion to string.

    2. String

      String is immutable, so when you want to dynamically create String, use StringBuffer.
      String name = "Nan Qin";
      Constructors// String(byte [], Charset)
      .charAt(int index): char char in Java is 2-byte
      + / .concat(String str); return a new string, the original string does not change.
      .hashCode() :int
      .length(): int // Array's length is not a function but an attributes.
      .toLowerCase();
      .toUpperCase();
      .substring(int beginindex);
      .substring(int beginindex, int endindex);

      StringBuffer

      Essential method, append/insert
      new StringBuffer();
      new StringBuffer(int initialCapa);
      new StringBuffer(String str);

      append(any type): //append any type, internally call .toString();
      insert(int offset, any type); // insert at the offset index, not after
      length();
      .toString();
      .reverse(): StringBuffer; the original does not change, return a new StringBuffer

    3. java.util.*

      1. Arrays

      Arrays is a class (not String [], int [])
      n*log(n)Arrays.sort(int [])... // float [], ..., in-place sort, return void., default increasing order.
      Arrays.sort(int [], int from, int to)
      Arrays.sort(int [], Comparator) // customized sort
      Print services: Default print array will print its address ..., Use Arrays.toString(int []) convert. 

                          class NameComparator implements Comparator<String> 
                    {          
                        public int compare(String a, String b) 
                        { 
                            return a.length() - b.length(); 
                        } 
                    }
      2. Set/HashSet/TreeSet

      Set<E>: An interface, .add() : boolean, .contains(), .size(), .remove(): boolean, .clear();
      HashSet: O(1) add, contain, remove ...
      TreeSet: sorted element when add, remove ... O(log(n))

      Loop set

                          Set<Integer> s = new Set();
                    for(Integer i : s){
                        System.out.println(i);
                    }
                    Interator<Integer> it = s.iterator();
                    while(it.hasNext()){
                        System.out.println(it.next());
                    }
      3. Map/HashMap, Map.Entry

      .containsKey(), get(key), put(key, value), remove(key), size(), .keySet()

      Loop

                          for (Map.Entry<Integer, Integer> entry : hm1.entrySet()) {
                        int value = entry.getKey();
                        int repeat = entry.getValue();
                        entry.setValue(value);
                    }
      4. LinkedList

    4. Binary Operator

      int 32-bit (2's complement): 0xff ff ff ff = -1; 0x80 00 00 00 = -2147483648 MIN; 0x7f ff ff ff = 2147483647 MAX;
      ^ XOR
      | OR
      & AND
      ~ NOT
